item.title: Millions of leaves falling every single day, 27th June
item.description:
The leaves from the tree which I don’t believe belongs to anyone yet hangs high over the street Anglesea road Br54aw near my home (28) if you was facing my house, outside the gate it would be to the left hand side high up a few doors down. The leaves fall constant and a huge amount with each gust of wind: You can swim in the amount that falls and gets I to every single area of my front and back garden. This is a huge inconvenience, a pain, it’s stressful, you can’t ever have a neat presentable garden or the pool In the summer without it being saturated in leaves. The neighbours all feel the same and it gets everyone down because as soon as you sweep or even harden hoover them they are soon back in the thousands! Surely we don’t have to live like this when trying to maintain a home, it’s so disheartening and annoying. Please can anyone help ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Anglesea Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping on the road., 27th June

item.title: Fallen tree debris needs removing, 27th June
item.description:
The fallen tree was removed from the driveway of Bickley Court earlier today (FixMyStreet ref: 7626596). The debris from the fallen tree (vine branches, leaves, broken trees and broken fence panels) now needs to be removed from the driveway. It is blocking vehicular access to the garages.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Grove, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Terrorist propaganda publicly displayed where your advertisers pay to promote their company’s., 27th June
item.description:
Promoting terrorism. Literal Hamas propaganda on your bus stop… REPEATEDLY. I’ve seen similar racist/antisemetic messaging displayed on this exact same bus stop numerous times. This has to be addressed properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 172, New Kent Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
